page.title: 11Chinley-a local impression/1
page.content: The Victorian railway station has been pulled down and very few trains now arrive or depart. Fewer still are the buses, making it difficult for villagers with no other form of transport to travel to other areas. The village will be quieter when the new by-pass is completed. It will take many years to heal the scars to the landscape and farm acres of 100 years ago have vanished for the needs of modern transport. But with the re-opening of Buxworth Canal Basin it is hoped to encourage more holiday makers to the area. The village is still growing, with new houses being built within the village and on the outskirts between Chinley and Chapel-en-le-Frith. The new people in these houses will hopefully merge with the rest. {(CONTINUED ON PAGE 12)
